alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 10:29AM EST until December 20 at 4:41AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall runoff continues. * WHERE...Portions of East Central and North Central Maine, including the following counties, in East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. Do not drive around barricades. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1024 AM EST, heavy rainfall runoff in the advisory area continues. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lincoln, Millinocket, Dover-Foxcroft, Howland, Patten, Brownville Junction, Milo, East Millinocket, Medway, Springfield, Lake View Plantation, Ebeemee, Licoln Township, Orneville, southern Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Sherman Station, White Cap Mountain, Baxter State Park, Frenchtown and Reed Plantation. - Numerous reports of flooding and washouts inside the advisory area impacting several roadways. - For Flood Safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
